dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description:
Tomli is a Python library for parsing TOML. Tomli is fully compatible
with TOML v1.0.0.
dependencies.name: py-tomli

dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).
dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description: Manipulate JSON-like data with NumPy-like idioms.
dependent_to.name: py-awkward

dependent_to.description:
Black is the uncompromising Python code formatter. By using it, you
agree to cede control over minutiae of hand-formatting. In return, Black
gives you speed, determinism, and freedom from pycodestyle nagging about
formatting.
dependent_to.name: py-black

dependent_to.description:
Python library for easily interacting with trained machine learning
models
dependent_to.name: py-gradio

dependent_to.description:
Python library for easily interacting with trained machine learning
models
dependent_to.name: py-gradio-client

dependent_to.description:
The HTTP Core package provides a minimal low-level HTTP client, which
does one thing only. Sending HTTP requests.
dependent_to.name: py-httpcore

dependent_to.description:
HTTPX is a fully featured HTTP client for Python 3, which provides sync
and async APIs, and support for both HTTP/1.1 and HTTP/2.
dependent_to.name: py-httpx

dependent_to.description: Jsonschema: An(other) implementation of JSON Schema for Python.
dependent_to.name: py-jsonschema

dependent_to.description: Optimized Einsum: A tensor contraction order optimizer.
dependent_to.name: py-opt-einsum

dependent_to.description: Data validation and settings management using Python type hinting.
dependent_to.name: py-pydantic

dependent_to.description:
scikit-build is an improved build system generator for CPython
C/C++/Fortran/Cython extensions. It provides better support for
additional compilers, build systems, cross compilation, and locating
dependencies and their associated build requirements. The scikit-build
package is fundamentally just glue between the setuptools Python module
and CMake.
dependent_to.name: py-scikit-build

dependent_to.description: An asynchronous networking framework written in Python
dependent_to.name: py-twisted

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
